content.description:
The chameleon-like Casa Batlló is one of the best examples of visionary architect Antoni Gaudi’s genius. A visit to this emblematic house invites you to discover a space that is no mere home but a masterpiece. A whole world of surprises and refined architectural details is waiting for you behind the striking Modernist façade. Beat the queues and experience the full splendour of this living museum at your own pace with an audio guide and map. So put on your headphones and learn all about this fascinating building.

The house has been departmentalised into five distinct areas and your audio guide will suggest a route to follow through each one, pointing out the highlights and details as you move along. Visit the Noble Floor with its great views over the upscale Passeig de Gracia. Explore the vast loft, once the Batlló family's laundry and storeroom, and then step out on to the roof terrace, built to resemble a dragon's back, and which has colourful mosaic chimney stacks.

Descend the communal stairwell, admiring the stained-glass windows and the meticulously designed bannisters, skylights and other details as you go. Then, in the entrance hall, marvel at the great wooden staircase. At times you'll feel like you're in an underground grotto or inside the entrails of a mythical beast, such was the visionary power of Gaudi's imagination. Once the tour finishes, you are free to stay on as long as you like, admiring this spellbinding house at your leisure.

Languages
Audioguide in Catalan, Spanish, English, French, German, Italian, Mandarin, Japanese, Russian and Portuguese.
content.summary: Discover one of the jewels in Barcelona’s Crown: a brilliant, colourful and distinctive masterpiece. The casa Batlló is a true reflection of the imagination and creative genius of Antoni Gaudí. Enjoy maximum flexibility and visit the house at your own leisure with this ticket! Visit at any time of the day during opening hours and let yourself be enchanted by the magic of this unforgettable building.
highligths: Admire a great modern piece of architecture
Skip the line and spend the time you like inside
Explore the house with the help of an audio guide

content.description:
Book your combined ticket now and enjoy a unique experience.

PortAventura Park
You’ll have the best time in one of the best theme parks in Spain, located in the charming Costa Daurada. Live through adventures in six different themed zones, including China, the Far West, Polynesia, Mexico, Mediterrània and SésamoAventura. In any zone, you’ll discover fantastical worlds and enjoy attractions and shows for all the family.

Shambhala is the star attraction of the park and offers a totally different experience. It’s the tallest rollercoaster (76 metres) and it’s the longest drop in all of PortAventura Park. In the short time it takes to go up the second tallest rollercoaster in Europe, you’ll feel as if you’re flying through the air as you whizz up and down in a ride that defies gravity with speeds up to 134km/h.

After all the emotions of the rides, you can relax and recharge your batteries in one of the park’s restaurants where you’ll have the chance to taste a variety of dishes from all over the world.

Ferrari Land
Put yourself in the shoes of an F1 driver and get to know the secrets of this prestigious Italian make and its creator, Enzo Ferrari. Up to 11 attractions using the most advanced technology await in this innovative park, dedicated to the exclusive world of Ferrari.

Live through all the sensations of F1 in the tallest and fastest vertical accelerator in Europe, where in just 5 seconds you’ll accelerate from 0 to 180 km/h to reach the highest point at 112 metres. Experience a release of adrenaline in the free fall Towers, a large-scale representation of all the mechanics. And there’s the bounce-back Tower, which will lift you up to the sky while simulating the movements of Ferrari pistons.

And if that’s not enough, in Ferrari Land you can compete with your family on the 570-metre race track, simulators and the opportunity to take a journey through Ferrari’s history in the Ferrari Experience.

Ticket Types and Terms of Use
The day you choose might be High Season or Low Season.

High Season tickets are valid for all season (subject to opening dates/times, entry terms and conditions and availability on the day).
Low Season tickets are valid for the date selected during the purchase process or for any other day as long as it is Low Season.

The 1 Day / 2 Parks Ticket gives you access to PortAventura Park and Ferrari Land on the same day.

The 2 Days / 2 Parks Ticket gives you access to PortAventura Park and Ferrari Land on the same day, in addition to another 1-day access to PortAventura Park. The two days of access must take place within 4 days from the date of the first visit.

The 3 Days / 2 Parks Ticket gives you access to PortAventura Park and Ferrari Land on the same day, in addition to another 2-day access to PortAventura Park. The three days of access must take place within 5 days from the date of the first visit.

Start/Opening times
Please check the opening days and times here.

Please note: Tickets for disabled guests or for visitors with special needs are only available at the Guest Service Office outside the main park's entrance. It will be necessary to provide official certification of a minimum disability of 33% at the time of collection.
content.summary: Don’t wait any longer to discover PortAventura Park and Ferrari Land, two theme parks that offer thrilling rides for all the family. In PortAventura Park you’ll live through unique adventures in any of its incredible themed zones, while in Ferrari Land you can explore your passion for the Italian motor-racing team.
highligths: Immerse yourself in the fascinating worlds of PortAventura Park
Visit the first Ferrari theme park in Europe

content.description:
Come and dive into the depths of the oceans and discover a fascinating and unfamiliar world, coming right up close to its inhabitants and learning about their curious behaviour along the way.

The aquarium is the world’s most important sea life leisure and education centre dedicated to the Mediterranean. Behold the denizens of the deep in the 35 tanks that are home to more than 11,000 animals from 450 species and walk through a spectacular 80-metre-long underwater tunnel. There’s also an immense Oceanarium, unique in Europe, with incredibly diverse species from giltheads to ocean sunfish, rays to morays and two kinds of sharks. All combine to make Barcelona Aquarium a truly special leisure attraction that has been admired by more than 14 million visitors.

Among the other attractions are the coral reefs, unique architectural creations of spectacular beauty. You’ll be entranced by the mini-aquaria where you get close up to the fascinating world of seahorses and other smaller sea creatures such as the captivating sea eagles and colourful sea anemones. At Planeta Aqua you will be able to see how sea life has adapted to different climatic conditions the highlight being a penguin amphitheater where you can even see these beautiful birds swimming under the water.
content.summary: Barcelona Aquarium in the historic Port Vell docklands makes for a fascinating day out for all the family.
highligths: Walk through the spectacular 80 metre long underwater tunnel
Visited by over 14 million people
See diverse species at the immense Oceanarium

activities.name: Barcelona Aquarium

Barcelona Zoo is located in the Parc de la Ciutadella and it opened in 1982.

Barcelona Zoo is a place where all the family can enjoy a day out. Its mission is to disseminate information, research and the protection of animal species in danger of extinction and to educate and make people aware of species at risk.

Its facilities faithfully reproduce the natural habitats of the animals that live there and pay particular attention to endangered species.

Barcelona Zoo has gathered 4,000 animals from 400 different species.

content.description:
Explore one of the biggest icons of Catalan culture, with the help of a helpful bilingual tour guide
who will be able to tell you the interesting history of the monastery and the changes it has undergone from its historical beginnings to the present. The monastery´s origin began in the hermitage of Santa María in the year 888 and between the years 1493 and 1835, a time of great growth and splendour, it became part of the Congregation of Valladolid.

Although the majority was lost during the Napoleonic War, the museum gathers a valuable set of artistic elements that you cannot miss. See objects related to the countries listed in the Bible, such as Mesopotamia, Cyprus, Egypt and Palestine, and admire an ancient collection of paintings from the 13th to the 18th century, in which you will find works by artists such as El Greco , Morales, Berruguete or Caravaggio.

Fall in love with the architecture of the Basilica which combines Gothic and Renaissance styles. Observe its atrium and its sacristy as well as an interesting permanent exhibition on the image of the Virgin which shows how it has changed over the years. In the audiovisual exhibition you will also have the opportunity to appreciate the talents of the singers, composers and teachers that make up the Choir of Montserrat.

Others
In addition, if you choose the option of entrance to the museum and liquor tasting you will have the opportunity to visit the Montserrat museum where the guide will explain the great cultural heritage of the museum.

Languages
English and Spanish (bilingual tour guide)
content.summary: Travel to the Montserrat Monastery and discover the spirituality of this magical place, located on a sacred mountain only an hour away by car to Barcelona. This iconic symbol of Catalonia is not only known for its important religious properties but also for the natural beauty of its surroundings.
highligths: Get to grips with both the past and present of the Montserrat Monastery
Enjoy an exhibition about the evolution of the image of the virgin
Appreciate the objects of great historical and artistic value in the museum and the Basilica

content.description:
Treat yourself to a wine tasting experience in a castle with a fascinating history; visit the cellars, stroll through the vineyards and enjoy an interesting wine tasting course as you head to the Oller del Mas Winery, one of the most important and beautiful wineries in the region situated in the foothills of Montserrat.

This impressive thousand year-old castle has retained some of its original walls which date back to the 10th century and the winery stretches over 1000 acres of land and boasts a golf course which is open to the public. This winery is a family run business that proudly produces some of the finest wines in the region within the stunning surroundings of a medieval castle. Delight your senses with this truly unique experience and learn all there is to know about the wine making process.

In the afternoon, your expert guide will lead you to the cellar and take you through the vines for a beautiful walk as you learn how the wine is made and discover all of its secrets before joining the wine tasting course where you will also taste three cheeses of an excellent quality, before returning peacefully to Barcelona.

Itinerary*
• 9:45am - Meet at Plaza Catalunya, 21
• 10am - Departure for Montserrat Monastery
• 11:30am - Guided visit through Montserrat Monastery
• 12:20pm - Free time at Montserrat (around 1 hour)
• 1:20pm - Meet your tour guide again
• 1:30 pm - Departure for the winery
• 2pm - Guided visit through the vineyards and the cellar
• 2:45pm - Wine tasting (3 local wines) and tapas lunch
• 3:45pm - Departure for Barcelona
• 5pm-5:30pm - Arrival to Barcelona**

*Please note that the itinerary order, times and duration may be subject to change due to unforeseen circumstances such as heavy traffic, accidents, diversions, severe weather, etc.
**Please note that the journey back to Barcelona takes between 60 to 90 minutes, depending on the traffic conditions.

activities.name: Montserrat Tapas and Wine

content.description:
The card’s benefits have been specially designed to make getting around the city easier than ever before and to grant access to ample attractions bringing together public transport and all the cultural and entertainment treats the city has to offer. The card is available to purchase for three, four or five days in a row.

Whether you prefer museums, art galleries, cathedrals or shopping, Barcelona has it all! The Barcelona Card provides you with free access to more than 20 of the most popular attractions of the city (including the Joan Miró Foundation, the Museum of Catalan Modernism and the Columbus Column), free transport around town and special discounts in more than 90 shops, restaurants, museums and many more places. There is skip-the-line access to a select list of museums. You will also receive a trilingual guidebook that includes details about discounts and freebies, area by area tourist information, a general city map and a route map of the metro network. The Barcelona Card is the best way to explore this amazing city at your own pace and at an affordable price.

Be given a super shopping card which entitles you to more than 80 perks in loads of shops unique to Barcelona. This type of card is truly one of a kind and lets you enjoy the shopping experience in Barcelona like never before.

Where better to start making the most of these discounts than The Barcelona Shopping Line! As the largest open-air retail hub in Europe – the five kilometre stretch turns the city into an enormous shop window which is open to the world. Asides from shopping, the architectural and cultural backdrop make the Barcelona Shopping Line a truly unique retail hub.

Languages
Two versions in three languages: Catalan/ Spanish/ English and French/ German/ Italian.
The Shopping Line map/guide is available in 8 languages.
content.summary: Carry Barcelona in your pocket with the brilliant Barcelona Card – it’s all you need to discover every corner of this fascinating and vibrant city.
highligths: Free access to 20 of the most visited attractions

Unlimited travel through the city on public transport

content.description:
Films, cars, planets and meteorites have been named after Barcelona as have bands and, of course, Freddie Mercury and Montserrat Caballé's hit song. There’s no doubt that on top of being one of the most vibrant, exciting and sophisticated cities in Europe, Barcelona is also a rock ‘n’ roll Mecca.

Like all great revolutions, the Hard Rock Cafe wasn’t meant to succeed. It was 1971 and as the Swinging Sixties had given way to the Super Seventies, fashions and tastes were changing. Two hungry young Americans were in London and couldn’t find a decent place to eat a decent burger… so they opened up a joint in the English capital. Their landlord didn’t think it would last and gave them just a six-month lease. Four decades later, there almost 200 Hard Rock Cafes in more than 50 countries worldwide.

The first T-shirt hit the streets in ‘74 and the first piece of memorabilia came, fittingly, by chance in ‘79 when Eric Clapton asked to hang his Lead II Fender guitar over his favourite bar stool and thus mark as his spot. Today, the rock 'n' roll collection has more than 74,000 pieces and is the largest of its kind. By 1982, the Hard Rock Cafe had gone global and the rest, as they say, is history (that’s still being written)! Choose from one of the following menus:

GOLD MENU

MAINS
Original Legendary® Burger
Fresh Black Angus steak burger, with smoked bacon, cheddar cheese, crispy onion ring, leaf lettuce and vine-ripened tomato, served with our signature steak sauce and seasoned fries on the side.
Moving Mountains® Burger
100% plant-based patty, topped with cheddar cheese and a crispy onion ring, served with leaf lettuce and vine-ripened tomato, and seasoned fries on the side.
Grilled Chicken Sandwich
Grilled chicken with melted Monterey Jack cheese, smoked bacon, leaf lettuce and vine-ripened tomato, served on a toasted fresh bun with honey mustard sauce and seasoned fries on the side.
Twisted Mac, Chicken & Cheese
Grilled chicken breast, sliced and served on cavatappi pasta tossed in a four-cheese sauce blend.
Grilled Chicken Caesar Salad
Grilled chicken with fresh romaine tossed in a classic tossed in a classic Caesar dressing, topped with parmesan crisps, croutons and shaved parmesan cheese.
Tupelo Chicken Tenders
Crispy chicken tenders served with seasoned fries, honey mustard and our house-made barbecue sauce.
BBQ Pulled Pork Sandwich - Until 31/12/2020 only.
Hand-pulled smoked pork with our house-made barbecue sauce, served on a toasted fresh bun with coleslaw, sliced Granny Smith apples and seasoned fries on the side.

DESSERT
Brownie
Warm chocolate brownie with chocolate sauce and fresh whipped cream.

DRINKS
1 Soft drink, coffee or tea

DIAMOND MENU

STARTERS
Until 31/12/2020 - Caesar Or House Salad or Nachos to Share ** (1 per every 3-4 guests)
From 1/1/2021 - Fresh Salad

MAINS
Original Legendary® Burger
Fresh Black Angus steak burger, with smoked bacon, cheddar cheese, crispy onion ring, leaf lettuce and vine-ripened tomato, served with our signature steak sauce and seasoned fries on the side.
Moving Mountains® Burger
100% plant-based patty, topped with cheddar cheese and a crispy onion ring, served with leaf lettuce and vine-ripened tomato and seasoned fries on the side.
Smoked BBQ Combo
Until 31/12/2020 - Slow-cooked Baby Back Ribs and hand-pulled smoked pork served with our house-made barbecue sauce. The perfect combination of our smokehouse specialties served with seasoned fries on the side.
From 1/1/2021 - Slow-cooked ½ rack of Baby Back Ribs and ½ grilled BBQ chicken served with our house-made barbecue sauce and seasoned fries on the side.
Grilled Salmon
Seasoned and grilled then topped with our chipotle aioli and served with grilled lemon, fresh vegetables and seasoned fries.
Twisted Mac, Chicken & Cheese
Grilled chicken breast, sliced and served on cavatappi pasta tossed in a four-cheese sauce blend.
Steak Salad
Grilled steak on a bed of fresh mixed greens tossed in a blue cheese vinaigrette, with pickled red onions, red peppers and Roma tomatoes, finished with crispy shoestring onions and blue cheese crumbles.
BBQ Chicken
Grilled chicken layered with signature spices and our signature barbecue sauce, served with fresh vegetables and seasoned fries.

DESSERT

**Depending upon party size starters to share may change as appropriate.
*Menu items subject to change and availability. Reservations only.
content.summary: Visit the Hard Rock Cafe Barcelona and feast on the best burgers in town while admiring the mesmerising memorabilia collection with items from legends such as Michael Jackson, Freddie Mercury, Kurt Cobain, Jimi Hendrix and stars like Shakira and Madonna. So after a long day's promenade on Las Ramblas, ‘ramble on’ over to the Hard Rock for a rockin' good time! Get VIP priority seating, skip the long lines and feel like a rock star!
highligths: Come to know just why Hard Rock Cafe finds itself in over 50 countries
Choose from many menus and pick what suits your taste buds the best

excluded.description: 4 glasses of wine (or soft drinks for those under the age of 18).

comments.description: Voucherless. You don’t need to bring any voucher (digital or printed)!

content.description:
Savour of the real Barcelona with this delectable tapas walking tour. Try traditional pa amb tomaquet and contemporary appetisers with a glass of wine or beer in local bars well off the beaten track on this 3-hour adventure for your taste buds!

The tour begins in the Raval, a once edgy and run-down area that has undergone radical transformation and is now inhabited by an eclectic mixture of immigrants, young artists, trendy students and earthy locals.

Feel like a local as you taste delicious tapas and a glass of red wine in a traditional bodega before strolling through the ancient alleyways of the beautiful Gothic Quarter to a bar with a secret garden. Here, you will taste Spanish ham and pa amb tomàquet (bread with tomato) accompanied with a glass of white or red wine.

From there, continue as we cross the old heart of Barcino, where you will learn about the history of this ancient city before sipping vermouth and indulging on exotic croquettes at a hidden and charming Bodega from the early 1900’s.

As you make the way to the next stop, you will see some Barcelona’s oldest businesses that date back to 1761, the Roman Walls and the Cathedral, before arriving at an old brewery dating back to 1897, which happens to be one of the most beautiful and famous Catalan Art-Nouveau establishments in Barcelona.

With Art-Nouveau in mind, enjoy a sweet end to the tour with at the final stop, a café located in a UNESCO World Heritage building.

This tour is an excellent way to discover the real people’s Barcelona; you'll get to meet the locals, learn about the city’s history and culture, and delight in the discovery of new tastes, textures and aromas.

activities.name: Barcelona Tapas tour in El Raval

PortAventura Caribe Aquatic Park

Head to all the attractions such as El Tifón or El Torrente and try other more relaxing ones like Mambo Limbo, the rapids or hydro-massage pools. There’s loads of slides, some only for the bravest.

In PortAventura Caribe Aquatic Park, you’ll find more than 50,000 m2 of fun in a lush environment with more than 4,300 tropical plants. For the little ones there’s an exclusive zone that includes, amongst others, a two-level pool and a pirate ship complete with characters from Sesame Street where they can let their imagination run wild.

The biggest attraction in the park is without doubt King Khajuna, the tallest slide in Europe. Don’t be scared by this giant structure – take on a free fall from a height of 31 metres with a dizzying 55-degree descent.

Ferrari Land
Put yourself in the shoes of an F1 driver and get to know the secrets of this prestigious Italian make and its creator, Enzo Ferrari. Up to 11 attractions using the most advanced technology await in this innovative park, dedicated to the exclusive world of Ferrari.

And if that’s not enough, in Ferrari Land you can compete with your family on the 570-metre race track, simulators and the opportunity to take a journey through Ferrari’s history in the Ferrari Experience.

PortAventura Nights
Awaken your adventurous spirit as night falls with entry that gives you access to attractions, shows, restaurants and shops up until midnight. Enjoy enchanting PortAventura at the end of the day, when it’s filled with colourful lights and a magical atmosphere.

The night ticket is valid from 22th of June to 7th of September, for visit from 19:00 until park closing. This ticket won't be available in case of Special Night*.

PortAventura Special Nights
PortAventura opens its doors on special occasions to celebrate themed nights in a truly festive atmosphere. In summer, during the White Nights, parades make their way through the streets with live music, shows and other surprises that will keep you awake until the early hours. There are also other special events such as the mysterious Halloween Night.

The 1-day ticket allows one day access to the selected park: PortAventura Park, Ferrari Land or Caribe Aquatic Park. The day you choose might be High Season or Low Season.

content.description:
Travel through history in Girona and immerse in the pristine scenery of Costa Brava. Experience a unique landscape along the way and head into the historic town of Girona. Enjoy a walking tour of the Old Town, have a look at the widest Gothic Cathedral in the world, and be surprised by the colorful spectacle of the houses along the Onyar River. After the Girona tour, drive to Costa Brava and breathe its unique surroundings and nature.

Highlights
• Marvel at the medieval architecture of Girona, while exploring the city's Jewish Quarter
• Soak up Girona's unique atmosphere by walking through its winding streets
• Visit a 19th-century iron bridge designed by Gustave Eiffel
• Get to see the most breathtaking views of the Costa Brava
• Visit the historical town of Pals and the fisherman’s village of Calella de Palafrugell
• A tour to ensure a better experience and more personal attention led by an expert guide

Start your tour with a comfortable pick-up at your accommodation in Barcelona to head directly to the historic town of Girona, where the remains of a Roman and medieval past coexist harmoniously with the present, offering a complex image full of contrasts. Get lost in the maze of narrow streets and travel through time in the best-preserved Jewish neighborhood in Europe with your professional guide.

Admire the Cathedral, boasting the widest Gothic nave in the world, and marvel at the colorful spectacle of houses along Onyar River, which splits the city in two. Because of its beautiful and historic scenery, the medieval center was chosen for some of the most important scenes in the popular series Game of Thrones. Whether by its many bridges crisscrossing the river or by its strong medieval walls, Girona charms its visitors with an exciting panorama.

After exploring Girona with your guide, we will drive to Costa Brava, the northern side of Catalonia’s sunny Mediterranean coast. Before delving completely into nature, we will stop at the picturesque village of Pals. This ancient medieval village was once a fortress, still featuring idyllic cobbled streets and picture-perfect plazas. Its towers and other viewpoints offer the best views over the Mediterranean Sea and will allow you to see as far as the fields and Empordà plains extending into the horizon.

Next, we will continue to the Catalan coast, where you will enjoy the most breathtaking views: green mountains, the sheer relief of the coast, and small villages with whitewashed houses built around the swell of the Costa Brava. We will stop in Calella de Palafrugell, a traditional fishing village that fully retains the charm of its past. Before exploring the surrounding area, we will take a moment to relax and taste some of the delicious local cuisines.

The Caminos de Ronda (ancient pathways), which you will observe near Calella, lead visitors to discover the most pristine corners of the region. Fishermen, watchmen, and smugglers once used these pathways, that allow you to explore the coastal scenery. Follow the pathways to uncover the most popular beaches in the area, as well as hidden coves and cliffsides. You can also take a dip in the crystal clear water, surrounded by unspoiled nature.

The perfect Catalan tour for your family and friends!

activities.name: Girona and Costa Brava - Tour with Transfers

content.description:
Here you will find over 2,000 m2 of galleries showcasing wonderful displays with nearly a thousand exhibits, including sarcophagi, mummies, jewellery and amulets, helping you towards a greater understanding of everyday life in the ancient civilisation of the Pharaohs. Displays include galleries dedicated to gods and Pharaohs as well as everyday artefacts, cosmetics, religion, work and eroticism.

The museum also offers guided tours of its collections led by learned Egyptologists, which are essential in order to give visitors a deeper understanding and knowledge of Egyptian culture and civilisation. In addition to the permanent collections and the temporary exhibitions, the museum also organises other activities which enable visitors to enjoy the collections in an entertaining, fun way.

Visit the museum in the evening and witness realistic enactments that will take you back 4000 years to the mysteries of the Nile. Or maybe you want to try the Eternal Banquet, a tour focussing on Ancient Egyptian cuisine where you can sample the foodstuffs eaten by the kings, priests, peasants and slaves of this ancient civilisation.

Others
The museum also houses a café, bookshop, souvenir shop and library.
content.summary: You may not associate Catalonia's vibrant capital with ancient Egypt but Barcelona's quirky Museum of Egyptology houses one of Europe's foremost private collections of Egyptian art and culture, with a strong commitment to research and the study and dissemination of the culture and history of Ancient Egypt.

content.description:
Uncover the rich history of the Gothic centre of Barcelona, which has developed since the Roman period to become the thriving capital of Catalonia that it is today.

Highlights
- Explore the highlights of the city, including the iconic Las Ramblas promenade, with a private guide.
- Try your luck at haggling in La Boquería marketplace, and see where locals shop for their produce and meats.
- Discover sleepy churchyards, medieval alleyways and crumbling Gothic Palaces.
- Learn about the Roman beginnings of the Old Town, and see remnants of this lost past.
- Finish your tour with a self-guided visit to the majestic Barcelona Cathedral with tickets included to the cathedral and its rooftop

The Gothic Quarter – also known as Barri Gòtic, is the area that stretches from La Rambla to Via Laietana, and from the Mediterranean seafront to Ronda de Sant Pere and is the centre of the old city of Barcelona.

It is known as the Gothic Quarter, as it used to be the location of a Roman village and some of the remnants still remain. Currently, the Gothic Quarter is one of the most exciting parts of the city as it’s home to some of Barcelona’s most famous landmarks, excellent restaurants, amazing restaurants and many squares (plaças) to relax and unwind.

Your tour will end with entrance tickets to the Barcelona Cathedral which you will be free to explore at your own pace.

The Cathedral of the Holy Cross and Saint Eulalia is a gorgeous Gothic cathedral in the old center of the bustling Catalan city; it is also the seat of the Archbishop of Spain.

The construction of the Cathedral began at the end of the 13th century during the reign of King James II of Aragon and took around 150 years to complete. While the structure and internal decoration of the Cathedral were completed by the 15th century, its neo-Gothic façade was added at the end of the 19th century, covering the rather plain original exterior; the roof (which your tickets give you access to) was also adorned with an impressive range of gargoyles.

Enjoy this masterpiece as the capstone to your highlights tour.

activities.name: Barcelona Highlights - Private Walking Tour with Barcelona Cathedral Ticket

routes.description: A Taste of Barcelona Tapas Tour

content.description:
Spain is known the world over for its food culture and heritage. Tapas restaurants have cropped up in every major city, but there’s nothing like having the authentic experience in the Catalán capital.

Highlights
- Enjoy several tapas tastings at various restaurants – all included and carefully curated by your expert foodie guide.
- Savour an assortment of Spain's finest dishes, delicacies and flavours.
- Visit a traditional Spanish food market.
- See highlights of the Gothic Quarter, including the wide passenger walkway ‘La Rambla.’
- Eat where the locals eat and drink while experiencing authentic Spanish cuisine.
- Learn about Catalonian tradition and the history of the diverse food from each region.

If you are passionate about food and if sampling the best of local cuisine is your top priority when you are on holiday, then this tour is how you should spend your time. Let yourself loose in Barcelona’s best tapas restaurants as you authentically experience Spain’s varied and traditional cuisine.

Tapas refer to a variety of appetizers or snacks. Served cold (for example olives and cheese) or warm (for example battered, baby squid), tapas have evolved into an elaborate gastronomic event, with most regions in Spain showcasing the best of local ingredients with their own unique flavours and styles of cuisine – anything from exotically flavoured, spicy Moorish stews of the south, to fresh grilled seafood from the coastal areas of Spain. No trip to Spain would be authentic without days filled with tapas samplings.

activities.name: A Taste of Barcelona - Private Tapas Tour

content.description:
We will pick you up at your hotel in Barcelona city to visit one of the nicest coastal areas of Catalonia and Spain, the Costa Brava. Also we will visit two of the most well preserved Medieval Villages near the coast, Pals and Peratallada.

We will start our tour in Calella de Palafrugell where it seems that time stands still, on the beach of Port Bo we still find the boats going to daily fishing. As if they waited for the storm to calm to go to the sea...Low and whitewashed cottages have been renovated but retain all the charm of yesteryear. The coastline in this area has been saved from the building frenzy has affected our coast lately. We also find the Indiano Colonial-style houses, build for the people who emigrate to America and return after making a fortune, most to Cuba. Some returned home with the longing of those lands and a sweet and sad music, the Havaneres. The singing of Havaneres of Calella, on a stage on the sea is celebrated in July on the beach of Port Bo, surrounded by boats packed with people they sing their melancholic songs.

A 15 minutes easy walk following a path by the sea (Camino de Ronda) will get you to Llafranc, a small Cove of golden sand with a small promenade, terraces and restaurants that give to it. And the sourranding hills it raises the lighthouse of Sant Sebastià with magnificent views over the coast.

From Llafranc we go to Begur, also a fishing village, with a castle at the top overlooking the coast and the plain of the Baix Empordà. Narrow streets and small squares. It also shares a past with Calella and Llafranc with a good number of houses of the Indianos. little gems that stand out over the simplicity of other buildings.
We will have lunch in Pals, where we can taste the delicious rice that is grown in this area. After lunch we will visit the Gothic quarter known as "Pedró", the Church of Sant Pere, the Tower of the hours... and to visit Peratallada, certainly a marvel of medieval civil architecture. We'll see how this small town retains its feudal inheritance intact, narrow, winding streets and stone buildings. We will see the wall, the moat, the Castle-Palace, the square with porches, all the old quarter.

activities.name: Private Tour from Barcelona: Costa Brava and Medieval Villages

content.description:
Make a pilgrimage to the mystical mountaintop retreat of Montserrat in this 5-hour excursion from Barcelona. Your guide will invite you on an exploration of this nearly 1,000-year old Benedictine Monastery set high above Catalonia. You’ll see the famous ‘Black Madonna’ icon and visit the legendary ‘Holy Cave’ where the virgin is said to have once appeared. End by enjoying the sublime singing of ‘La Escolanía de Montserrat’, one of Europe’s oldest children’s choirs.

Highlights
• Half-day trip to the mystical mountaintop monastery of Montserrat
• Admire the famous 'Black Madonna', an icon in the monastery basilica
• Explore the 'Holy Cave' where the Virgin is said to have once appeared
• Enjoy astonishing views of the natural park
• Great way to explore the region near Barcelona

Take a break from sightseeing in the city, and join us on this exciting adventure to one of the most mysterious and magical places in Catalonia.

Enjoy this tour with your passionate guide, who will give you expert local insights into our most deeply rooted cultural traditions. We will pick you up at your accommodation and take comfortable transportation to the mountain of Montserrat.

This magnificent 4,000-foot wonder is easily recognizable from afar by its “serrated” top from which it gets its name. And 2,380 feet above sea level, the Benedictine monastery of Santa Maria de Montserrat enjoys a stunning location, surrounded by an unforgettable natural landscape.

The monastery has served as a center for spiritual retreat for almost one thousand years. We will first visit the basilica, where the Virgin Santa Maria of Montserrat, Patron Saint of Catalonia, is located. The Romanesque statue of “the Black Madonna” originates from the XII century and is today surrounded by a golden altar. According to legend, the Virgin personally appeared in the IX century, giving rise to the hermitage of Santa Maria.

Next, take a walking tour of the monastery surroundings. Enjoy the unparalleled views offered by this region, which was declared as a Natural Park in 1987. We will also discover the Holy Cave where the virgin is said to have appeared with your professional local guide. The site has, since then, become an authentic center for pilgrimage and prayer.

A musical treat will conclude our mystical Montserrat visit: we will listen to the angelic voices of La Escolania de Montserrat, one of the oldest boys' choirs in Europe (subject to seasonal availability).

activities.name: Montserrat - Half Day Tour with Transfers

content.description:
Casa Amatller is an architectural gem of Modernism, built by the architect Puig i Cadafalch for the industrialist chocolatier Antoni Amatller between 1898 and 1900. Visitors will enjoy an authentic modernist house with its original decoration. Casa Amatller broke for the first time the ornamental sobriety and the limits of height during the period. In the facade Puig i Cadafalch reinterpreted diverse styles and played with the asymmetries and the Chromatism.

The decoration of the whole House develops a iconographic program concerning the Amatller family and the hobbies of Antoni, such as the Photography. Puig i Cadafalch skilfully combined Catalonia's home-grown art nouveau style, modernisme, based on the use of traditional arts and crafts, with a neo-Gothic style and an unusual stepped cornice inspired by the houses of the Netherlands.

Some of the finest artists of the time, including Jujol, worked with Puig i Cadafalch on the project. he house retains all its original furnishings and decoration, as well as an outstanding archaeological glass collection.

Video-guided visit
The visit begins on the ground floor of the building. A guide will accompany you to the unique main floor, home of the Amatller family.

Once there, this guide offers each of the participants a touch tablet connected to headphones that will provide them with the information relating to each area of the house as they are visited, in addition to explaining the Casa Museu Amatller through the historial context, the Amatller family and the architecture and decoration of Catalan modernism. Period photographs, plans, videos, etc. are used to accompany the information.

Also and unlike other visits, the visitor is accompanied at all times by this guide, to assit and answer all questions that visitors wish to make.

Guided Tour
In depth visit of the Casa Museu Amatller explained by a specialist Art guide. The visit, lasting approximately one hour, will introduce you to a magical and unique atmosphere that will make your stay an authentic journey back in time.

At the beginning of the visit, the guide will wait for you at the ticket office located at the building´s main entrance to accompany you through the ground floor and the main staircase until you reach the unique main flooor, home of the Amatller family.

During your visit, you will get complete and detailed information about the historical context, the Amatller family and the architect Puig i Cadafalch, as well as getting to know and discovering all the elements of Catalan Modernism architecture and the house´s decoration and furniture, all designed in the original style of the period.

activities.name: Casa Amatller

content.description:
Leave the hustle and bustle of Barcelona behind and travel back in time to discover the medieval city of Girona. Walk through the defensive walls of the city to enjoy great bird’s eye views of the surrounding area. Visit the best-preserved Jewish Quarter of Europe and marvel at the Gothic Cathedral, famous for having the world’s widest Gothic nave. Continue to Dali’s hometown, travel to Figueres to visit the Dali Theatre Museum, the largest surrealist object in the world and a present that Dali himself wanted to leave to his city.

Highlights
• Marvel at the medieval architecture of Girona, while exploring the city's Jewish Quarter
• Soak up Girona's unique atmosphere by walking through its winding streets
• Visit a 19th-century iron bridge designed by Gustave Eiffel
• Explore Figueres, the artist's birthplace and current home of the Dalí Museum
• Tour the Dalí Museum in Figueres, dedicated to the city's most famous creative genius
• Get an inside look at the life of Salvador Dalí during a guided tour of his former residence
• Learn about the formative experiences that inspired and shaped Dali’s work

After morning pickup at your Barcelona accommodation, travel with your guide for about 1 hour to reach the colorful city of Girona. During the drive, learn about Girona’s long and rich history, from its ancient Roman roots through a thriving medieval era and evolution into a hip, modern Spanish city.

When you arrive, explore Old Town on a walking tour that takes you through past landmarks like the Girona Cathedral and an iron bridge designed by famous French engineer Gustave Eiffel.

Get a sense of life in medieval Spain while wandering through the city’s labyrinthine Jewish quarter, and rest your feet over a cup of coffee in a charming Old Town cafe. With your expert guide continue your tour to the small town of Figueres, located near the French border. Best known as the birthplace of surrealist artist Salvador Dalí, Figueres honors the legacy of its famous former resident with the Dalí Museum — designed by the artist himself and considered the world’s largest surrealist object.

Explore Dalí’s life and work through the museum’s collection of his dimension-bending paintings and other original artifacts (entrance fee not included).

Relax on the return drive through the countryside to Barcelona, where the 10-hour tour concludes with drop-off at your original departure point in the evening.

activities.name: Girona and Dali Museum in Figueres - Tour with Transfers

content.description:
Step into the magical music box that is the Palau de la Música Catalana and a treasure of Art Nouveau architecture will be revealed before your eyes. Beginning in the Foyer, wide arches ornately decorated with ceramic flowers welcome you in and provide an inspiring start to the tour. The tour leads you deeper into the building to the Rehearsal Hall of the Orfeó Catala, still used to this day after more than 100 years, where the foundation stones to the building were first laid. Continue along the grand staircase that will equally impress with its intricate decoration, before arriving into the Lluís Millet Hall, where you can catch sight of the large balcony adorned with columns symbolising every kind of flower.

Next is the pièce de résistance every visitor has been waiting to see: the Concert Hall. You’ll be spellbound by jaw dropping rich colours and decoration that inspire artists to this day. Admire the natural golden light that enhances the hall from the impressive skylight on the second floor, before ending the tour on a musical note to the sounds of the organ. The magnificence and vibrancy of the sculptures, mosaics, stained glass and ironwork that characterise the Palau, are brought to the foreground on this not to be missed tour.

Duration
55 minutes

Start/opening time
Open daily: from 10am to 3pm
Easter and July: from 10am to 6pm
August: from 9am to 8pm

Languages
Spanish, Catalan, English, French
content.summary: Discover one of the most symbolic buildings in Barcelona; be inspired by rich colours and be amazed by grand architecture on a tour into the Palau de la Música Catalana. One of the most recommended tourist attractions in Barcelona, this tour is not to be missed.

activities.name: Tour of the Palau de la Música Catalana

content.description:
On this Private full day tour from Barcelona city, you will enjoy the medieval atmosphere of two cities with a very important Jewish community, one noted for his studies of Kabbalah, Girona and the other by their doctors of international fame, Besalú.

After picking you up at the hotel where you stay in Barcelona City we will head to the village of Besalú, about 1,5 hours from Barcelona and gateway to the Natural Park of the Volcanic area of la Garrotxa.

The county town of Besalú conserves a unique set of Jewish heritage in Catalonia: a Mikveh from the 12th century and traces of a synagogue closed in the 13th century. In 1966 Besalú was declared a national historic-artistic site. Since that time many finds have been made and amazing recovery of heritage has been developed. Its medieval, irregular laid out streets adapted to the city's orography, the arches, the steps, the stone houses, the shops that open all the year round to offer the traveller the craft products of the district, the superb Romanesque bridge providing access to the urban core, passing over the waters of the Fluvià..., everything in Besalú retains the charm of a time when this now small settlement of the Girona Garrotxa was a major market and the head of a prosperous, powerful county whose Jewish doctors enjoyed international fame and whose aljama, in the service of the counts, possibly accounted for between ten and fifteen per cent of its population.

After the visit to Besalú we will move to Girona city, undoubtedly the city with most medieval and Jewish heritage of this area and with one of the best preserved Jewish quarters of the Middle Ages in Europe.

The labyrinthic distribution and medieval atmosphere of its streets, the steep steps make frequently avoid the different levels of urban orography, the charm of the barri vellshops, the historic and didactic contribution of the Bonastruc ça Porta centre and, in particular, the firm commitment to recovering the old Jewish quarter make the Girona Jewish quarter into a unique, fascinating place. The transformations the district underwent after expulsion of the Jews in 1492 have not prevented the call dels jueus from retaining today a large part of this Kabbalistic mystery which characterised the Jews of Girona in an environment which has remained in exactly the same spot since the Middle Ages.

activities.name: Private Tour from Barcelona: Jewish History in Girona and Besalú

content.description:
Discover one of Gaudi´s world-famous masterpieces, Park Güell. Learn about the symbolism of this impressive feat of architecture and enjoy some of the best views of Barcelona. You will get to visit this park while guided by an expert guide.

Highlights
• Gain priority access to Park Güell, a beautifully landscaped park decorated with Gaudí's works.
• Visit the park with an expert and enthusiastic guide
• Learn about Gaudí’s life and work
• Discover the secrets of Park Güell, and that of its architect through its hidden symbolism

Discover the magical park Güell in a guided walking tour with an expert guide. In the park’s famous gardens, Gaudí combined his unique architectural style with elements of nature. The result is a place of pure fantasy, guaranteed to amaze you.

Park Güell is located towering over the lively, bohemian neighborhood of Gràcia on the top of a hill that provides spectacular views of Barcelona. Visiting the park with an expert guide only for you will allow you to have a more personalized experience and understand its secrets fully.

Listen as your guide offers fascinating insights into Gaudí, the most famous architect in the world and the main exponent of modernism (the catalan version of art nouveau) . Explore the work of this visionary modernist architect, and learn the secrets of how he realized his goals.

Gaudí’s peculiar architectural style was inspired by organic forms found in nature, clearly demonstrated by this dreamy collection of gardens, your guide will show you the symbolism hidden through the park and its relation to nature. Discover narrow alleys with undulating forms, like rivers of molten lava, which are covered by columns shaped like trees, stalactites and other geometric shapes.

Thanks to its privileged location on top of a hill, Park Güell has some of the best views of Barcelona. During this visit you will be able to take amazing photos of this architectural masterpiece with the whole city of Barcelona as a background.

The park was declared a UNESCO World Heritage Site in 1984 and is an essential part of a visit to Barcelona.

activities.name: Park Güell - Guided Tour

importantInfo: Children must be accompanied by an adult.

content.description:
Observe Barcelona from different points of view: start in the famous Ramblas with a walking tour in the Old Town and the Raval area, continue with great views from the Montjuic Cable Car to end with an exclusive visit to the Montjuic Castle. Get to know the secrets of the Spanish Civil War and end with the best views from the Castle’s Tower: a 360º views over Barcelona where on clear days you can see even the Pyrenees.

Highlights
• The best bird’s eye views of Barcelona and its surroundings
• Breathtaking Cable Car ride on both ways
• Exclusive visit to Montjuic Castle Dungeons and to the Tower
• Walking tour of the Raval district, the off the beaten path neighbourhood of Barcelona Old Town

Start your tour at the famous Ramblas, the heart of the city centre. Enjoy this walking tour of the Old Town and visit the famous Boqueria Market, considered one of the best markets in the world because of its modernist design and the richness of products it offers.

Pass by the Gran Teatre del Liceu, the finest modernist building and one of Europe's leading opera houses. Located on the Rambla, every year it hosts major opera and ballet productions and symphony concerts. At the beginning of the century, the high class of Barcelona wanted to live in the city centre. The most remarkable example of this desire is the Palau Guell, the house of the same Guell family that founded the construction of the Park Guell and the major patron of Gaudi’s work.

With your expert guide have a look at the façade of this private house, where a young Gaudi shows already all his talent to master the light and create beautiful shapes even with very limited space.

Continue your walking tour to discover the Raval, the most multicultural and off the beaten path district of Old Town, that attracts people from diverse social, cultural and geographical backgrounds.
Visit the Rambla del Raval to take a picture with the enormous Cat Statue by Fernando Botero, probably the cutest statue you will ever see.

Take the Montjuic funicular and get ready for the best views of Barcelona from the top. Enjoy the breathtaking views from the Montjuic Cable Car and wonderful views of Barcelona’s iconic skyline.

Reach the Montjuic Castle with your expert guide and enjoy an exclusive visit. The Montjuic Castle has been a military fortress since its early beginning, witnessing the change of political power in the city.
We invite you to an exclusive visit, not opened to the general public, where you will be able to enter the dungeons of the several political prisoners that have marked the history of the city.

Arise from the dungeons to the sky to admire a bird’s eye view of Barcelona and its surroundings. The best way to admire Barcelona in all its beauty is from high above the city. This is where the city reveals itself in total splendour. By this exclusive visit, access to the Tower of the Castle, and admire 360º views over Barcelona and, if the day is bright and clear, up to the Pyrenees.

Return to the Old Town by Cable Car: relax and enjoy the ride. Your tour ends in a very good area for some local tapas. Ask your guide for the best spots to visit!

activities.name: Barcelona Old Town and Sky Views: Montjuic Castle and Cable Car - Half-Day Tour

content.description:
Explore the best of Barcelona on a private tour of Gaudi’s imprint on the city, with tickets to La Sagrada Familia, Casa Batlló, and Park Güell.

Highlights
- Be met by a private guide, who will escort you throughout the day.
- Enjoy tickets included to three of Barcelona’s main attractions: La Sagrada Familia, Casa Battló, and Park Güell.
- Enjoy a private tour of Casa Battló as it opens for the day.
- See two architectural marvels of Gaudi’s work – Casa Vicens and Casa Milá.
- Travel in a private vehicle to Park Güell, with breathtaking views over the city.
- Enjoy a private tour of La Sagrada Familia for an hour, before your tour ends.

A trip to Barcelona would be incomplete without exploring Gaudí's imprint on the city. Not only was he one of the most influential architects of Barcelona’s modern and art nouveau period in the late 19th and early 20th century, but in history. His architectural masterpieces helped transform the city of Barcelona to the thriving, bustling, historical and cultural metropolitan city it is today.

In Dreta de l'Eixample view the world-renowned Casa Batlló (with tickets included), Casa Milá, and Casa Vicens Gaudi. You will get a sense of Gaudí’s innovative and eccentric mind as you walk into the various edifices designed by Gaudí, from the cathedral spires at La Sagrada Familia to the gingerbread gatehouses, grottos and ceramic animals in Park Güell. You will be transformed into another world as you enter the eccentrically designed spaces.

activities.name: Gaudi's Barcelona: Sagrada Familia, Park Güell and Casa Batlló - Private Tour

content.description:
We will pick you up at your hotel in Barcelona city early in the morning to take you to the volcanic area of Girona Province, We will begin our visit with the spectacular medieval village of Besalú. The old bridge over the river Fluvià transports us to far-off times of Romanesque style with seven arches of angulation has about 105 m long and 30 m in height with included Tower and speaks of the importance of the villa in medieval times.

The villa has unique jewish heritage in Catalonia. The Jewish baths, Miqvé, largest in Europe and remains of an ancient synagogue of the XIII century.

Then, we will visit the town of Castellfollit de la Roca with the profile of the Church and terraced houses on the top of the cliff, next to the precipice, it has become one of the most photographed and painted in Catalonia; it is also a magnificent natural viewpoint from which you can see the valleys of two rivers, the Fluvià and the Toronell.

If the weather is good, we will make a stop, a small 30-minute walk to visit the Romanesque hermitage of Santa Margarida, located inside the crater of the volcano of the same name. We will enjoy this incredible location of the hermitage and the beauty of the landscape that surrounds it.

We will continue to the village of Santa Pau, which in addition to a typically medieval aspect (with walls, irregular streets and evocative corners), drawn in the first half of the 14th century, has remarkable value buildings, the main virtues of the enclosure are the dominant austerity and the practical and functional nature that reveal the stones. The village of Santa Pau was declared of historic and artistic interest in 1971.

The main produce of this town are the Santa Pau beans grown in the volcanic soil near this town for many years only for self-consumption and today they are very appreciated by the fineness of there flavor.

To finish we will go to the Lake of Banyoles that represents the largest mass of continental waters in Catalonia, with a great landscape value and a sign of the Catalan collective identity. It is the second largest natural lake in the Iberian peninsula and its origin is tectonic and karst. We will learn the legends that surround it while we have a nice walk around. After this visit we will come back to Barcelona, to your hotel. You will arrive there about 6pm.

activities.name: Private Tour from Barcelona: Banyoles, Besalú and Volcanic Zone

content.description:
The capital of Catalunya is also one of the capitals of many important arts in Spain. Starting with football, with mighty FC Barcelona, until the pictorial arts with names as Picasso, Dali and Gaudí, Barcelona combines modern and historic architecture in a unique way. Founded by the Romans, it became the capital of the county of Barcelona by the Middle Ages and then by merging with the Kingdom of Aragon, the capital of the Principality of Catalonia.

Barcelona has been also the centre of Catalan separatism, since at least the Catalan Revolt of 1640, through the centuries, wars and regimes and still standing proud today. At Plaza Nova and Sant Jaume Square you will see roman ruins that witness the birth of the city, over 2000 years ago. The monumental medieval architecture will take you to the middle ages, like in Plaça del Rei, with the viceroy’s palace and the beautiful Palau Reial, where the Spanish Catholic kings received Christopher Columbus when he returned from his first journey to the New World.

See the outside of the cathedral of Barcelona and the Santa Maria del Mar church, the best examples of Catalan gothic style. Discover the jewish neighbourhood of El Call, and discover the contrasts that have marked Catalan and Spanish history. Walk through the Las Ramblas avenue, known for its street artists, little coffees and traditional Catalonian restaurants. We will unveil the complex layers of this city’s complex past, through a city neighborhood that never lost its ancient atmosphere even today. An unique opportunity to experience this unique side of Barcelona.

You will see:
*Plaza Nova and the Roman times;
*Las Ramblas;
*El Born;
*La Boqueria;
*Catedral de la Santa Cruz y Santa Eulalia de Barcelona;
*El Call, the jewish quarter;
*Salón del Tinell;
*Capella de Santa Àgata;
*Palau del Lloctinent;
*Palau Major.

You will learn about:
*History of Catalunya;
*Foundation legends connected to Hannibal and Hercules;
*Roman period;
*Arrival of the Visigoths;
*Muslim domain;
*Reconquista;
*Spanish Rule;
*Civil war and Franco dictatorship;
*Modern life.

activities.name: Barcelona by Walking - Private Tour
